items.text: I feel energized when I start a new project.
items.rationale: Initiating new activities is a key aspect of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I often pursue activities that bring me excitement.
items.rationale: Seeking excitement is a characteristic of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I am always looking for new opportunities to have fun.
items.rationale: Seeking fun and new opportunities is indicative of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I tend to act quickly when I see a chance for reward.
items.rationale: Quick action in response to potential rewards is a trait of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I often feel driven to achieve my goals.
items.rationale: Goal-directed behavior is a core component of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I enjoy taking risks if there's a potential for a big payoff.
items.rationale: Risk-taking for potential rewards is associated with the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I am motivated by the possibility of success.
items.rationale: Motivation by success is a characteristic of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I often feel a surge of energy when I think about my ambitions.
items.rationale: Feeling energized by ambitions is linked to the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I am always on the lookout for new experiences.
items.rationale: Seeking new experiences is a trait of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I feel a strong urge to chase after my dreams.
items.rationale: Chasing dreams is indicative of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I am quick to act on my impulses when I see something I want.
items.rationale: Acting on impulses for desired outcomes is a feature of the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I often feel a rush of excitement when I start something new.
items.rationale: Excitement from new beginnings is associated with the Behavioral Activation System.

items.text: I sometimes find it hard to resist the temptation of a new opportunity.
items.rationale: Temptation by new opportunities can indicate the Behavioral Activation System, but may also relate to impulsivity.

items.text: I often feel restless if I'm not pursuing something exciting.
items.rationale: Restlessness without excitement can suggest the Behavioral Activation System, but might also relate to anxiety.

items.text: I sometimes act without thinking when I'm excited about a new idea.
items.rationale: Could map to low Conscientiousness (impulsivity) or Behavioral Activation System (excitement-driven action).

items.text: I often feel anxious about making mistakes.
items.rationale: Anxiety about mistakes is a key feature of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I tend to avoid situations where I might fail.
items.rationale: Avoidance of potential failure is characteristic of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I am often cautious when trying something new.
items.rationale: Caution in new situations is indicative of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I frequently worry about the consequences of my actions.
items.rationale: Worrying about consequences is a trait of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I often feel tense in unfamiliar situations.
items.rationale: Tension in unfamiliar situations is associated with the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I am usually hesitant to take risks.
items.rationale: Hesitance to take risks is a feature of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I often feel the need to double-check my work.
items.rationale: Double-checking work is indicative of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I am quick to notice potential dangers.
items.rationale: Noticing potential dangers is a characteristic of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I often feel uneasy when things are uncertain.
items.rationale: Unease with uncertainty is linked to the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I am often on guard against possible threats.
items.rationale: Being on guard against threats is a trait of the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I tend to overthink potential problems.
items.rationale: Overthinking problems is associated with the Behavioral Inhibition System.

items.text: I sometimes feel paralyzed by fear of making the wrong choice.
items.rationale: Fear of making wrong choices can indicate the Behavioral Inhibition System, but might also relate to indecisiveness.

items.text: I often feel nervous when I have to make a decision.
items.rationale: Nervousness in decision-making can suggest the Behavioral Inhibition System, but may also relate to general anxiety.

items.text: I sometimes avoid new experiences because they make me anxious.
items.rationale: Could map to low Openness (avoidance of new experiences) or Behavioral Inhibition System (anxiety-driven avoidance).

items.text: I often feel a strong urge to defend myself when threatened.
items.rationale: Defensive reactions to threats are a key feature of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I tend to react quickly when I feel in danger.
items.rationale: Quick reactions to danger are characteristic of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I often feel the need to escape when I'm scared.
items.rationale: The urge to escape when scared is indicative of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I am quick to confront someone if I feel threatened.
items.rationale: Confrontation in response to threats is a trait of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I often feel frozen when I'm overwhelmed by fear.
items.rationale: Freezing in response to fear is associated with the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I am usually on high alert in unfamiliar environments.
items.rationale: High alertness in unfamiliar environments is a feature of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I often feel a rush of adrenaline when I'm in a tense situation.
items.rationale: Adrenaline rushes in tense situations are indicative of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I am quick to react defensively when I feel attacked.
items.rationale: Defensive reactions to perceived attacks are characteristic of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I often feel the need to run away from stressful situations.
items.rationale: The urge to flee from stress is linked to the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I am often ready to fight back when provoked.
items.rationale: Readiness to fight back when provoked is a trait of the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I tend to feel immobilized when I'm extremely anxious.
items.rationale: Immobilization due to anxiety is associated with the Fight-Flight-Freeze System.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by the need to protect myself.
items.rationale: Feeling overwhelmed by self-protection can indicate the Fight-Flight-Freeze System, but might also relate to general anxiety.

items.text: I often feel a strong urge to hide when I'm scared.
items.rationale: The urge to hide when scared can suggest the Fight-Flight-Freeze System, but may also relate to social anxiety.

items.text: I sometimes react aggressively when I'm startled.
items.rationale: Could map to high Neuroticism (emotional reactivity) or Fight-Flight-Freeze System (aggressive response to threat).

items.text: I often feel a strong need to connect with others.
items.rationale: The need for social connection is a key feature of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I tend to seek comfort from friends when I'm upset.
items.rationale: Seeking comfort from friends is characteristic of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I often feel better after talking to someone about my problems.
items.rationale: Feeling better after social interaction is indicative of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I am quick to offer support to friends in need.
items.rationale: Offering support to others is a trait of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I often feel a sense of belonging when I'm with others.
items.rationale: Feeling a sense of belonging in social settings is associated with the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I am usually empathetic towards others' feelings.
items.rationale: Empathy towards others is a feature of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I often feel a strong desire to maintain harmony in my relationships.
items.rationale: Desire for harmony in relationships is indicative of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I am quick to forgive others to preserve relationships.
items.rationale: Forgiveness to maintain relationships is characteristic of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I often feel a need to share my experiences with others.
items.rationale: Sharing experiences with others is linked to the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I am often motivated to help others feel better.
items.rationale: Motivation to help others is a trait of the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I tend to feel more secure when I'm part of a group.
items.rationale: Feeling secure in groups is associated with the Socioemotional Regulation System.

items.text: I sometimes feel overwhelmed by the emotions of those around me.
items.rationale: Being overwhelmed by others' emotions can indicate the Socioemotional Regulation System, but might also relate to high sensitivity.

items.text: I often feel a strong need to be understood by others.
items.rationale: The need to be understood can suggest the Socioemotional Regulation System, but may also relate to self-esteem issues.

items.text: I sometimes prioritize others' needs over my own to keep the peace.
items.rationale: Could map to low Assertiveness (self-sacrifice) or Socioemotional Regulation System (relationship maintenance).
